item.title: Create rename and delete a file
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“MujaheD, post:20, topic:297927”]Thanks for the help^

Another question: Doesn’t System.out.println only take string parameters? he used:

System.out.println("File deleted: " + f.delete());

And I don’t see him deleting the file anywhere but there, and it was within System.out.println.[/quote]

What? No, it takes many different argument types. API docs anyone? And I don’t see whats wrong with that code…

Read full topic
item.source: Create rename and delete a file

item.title: Create rename and delete a file
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

by doing something like:

String s = "" + aBoolean; the compiled code results in creating a string buffer and appending the “aBoolean” value to the string through append(). stringbuffer.append takes various arguments, among them, a boolean.

ps whenever using the ‘+’ operator on a string, the compiler interprets this as a call to stringbuffer.append(). oh and by the way, system.out.println does not only take string arguments.

Read full topic

l2java

ps as far as i know, you attempt to program java. so me succeeding at doing so proves that i have no life? by the way, i love the “you have no life but i do” excuse that everyone seems to use on the internet. can you prove it? no. therefore, innocent until proven guilty

item.title: Create rename and delete a file
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:9, topic:297927”][quote author=oksuper_ link=topic=394341.msg2931628#msg2931628 date=1251318815]
abraham2119, respect your greater. Ownagesbot has been around since you were probably just a little noob wondering how to run your server. Show him respect and maybe everyone might not hate you. BTW, apparently he did… or he wouldn’t of assumed the user had a C:\ partition, and maybe wouldn’t of used the escaped backslash… think before you post.
[/quote]rofl. greater as in longer? because as far as i know, even people who have been around the longest tend to be mistaken (ie you). if the “respect” you want me to give him is not to dare to prove him wrong, then stop trying.

no he didnt. he obviously believes everyone has a C: partition. use some fucking common sense, who would PURPOSELY limit their application to run on a single system (other than the creators of the system)???[/quote]I don’t know you. I don’t know anything about you. But you sound like a complete retard, please stop posting for the sake of my health.

Read full topic
